message:
Something weird is happening today, I am getting security notices from Google Chrome when I try to access websites over https like MDN. Anybody noticed anything?

Edit: Currently it is happening consistently when I try to access MDN or LinkedIn

data.message: what is your certificate path for this website ?
Sounds bad! Can you tell us the details of this security notice?
This is the content of the message
click advanced and show the message
This is the error in the console when I check the https details
Something fishy is happening, for a week now I am not able to connect to SSH unless through a VPN

Not happening for me !
Tried with MDN over HTTPS, worked without any security notices.
Using Chrome 51.0.2704.106 (64-bit) on Ubuntu.
Also, Been able to connect to SSH without any issues through the past week and till Today. Without VPN sure.

this is not a "general" issue , i have been able to use VPN and SSH and all websites without issues , this seems targeted or limited to groups of users

could be a network attack or a targeted spyware, could be something else we don't know yet

If you are in hotel or coffee shop wifi then this could be the issue, the firewalls they using with requires to sign in using a username and password to get Internet access could be changing the certificate to an invalid one until you log on.
Exactly check the time and date. If they are correct please press on the view certificate and take a screenshot of the certificate it self

Time and date are perfect.
I think it's something related to the network I am using at home or it is ISP related. Right now I am at work and everything works flawlessly. I can confirm now that it is ISP related
If anyone use Orange DSL (LinkDSL) please provide your feedback whether you're facing that issue or not.
There has been a lot of weird behaviour with SSL lately. Ramy Raoof wrote a long post about this in the group some time ago.
شوف كده تاريخ الجهاز ممكن يكون في certificate قديمه بتحاول أبديت certificate جديده
